segments.key_quote: After inquiring about proper self-knowledge from the son of Vyasa Deva, who will be a great philosopher, he will renounce all material attachments and achieve a life of fearlessness.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and explains its meaning, focusing on the attainment of fearlessness through self-knowledge and detachment.
segments.transcript: In this session, we will be discussing from the 28th verse of the 12th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam: Jigna Sitaatam Yatharthyo Muner Vyasa Sutadasau Hithvedam Rupa Gangayam Yasyati Adha Akutobhayam. The meaning of this verse is: After inquiring about proper self-knowledge from the son of Vyasa Deva, who will be a great philosopher, he will renounce all material attachments and achieve a life of fearlessness, Akutobhayam.

segments.key_quote: Material knowledge means ignorance of the knowledge of one's own self.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's explanation of the verse, emphasizing the difference between material and spiritual knowledge, and the importance of understanding one's true self as a spirit soul.
segments.transcript: So Srila Prabhupada explains this is the foretelling about what will happen when he is cursed to die within seven days. He will renounce all material attachments and he will go to the sacred place on the bank of the river Ganga, and he will inquire about proper self-knowledge from the son of Vyasa Deva, from Shukadeva Goswami, Vyasa Sutta, and he will achieve a life of fearlessness. So what is that life of fearlessness? Prabhupada explains in the purport: Material knowledge means ignorance of the knowledge of one's own self. The self is spirit, spirit soul, spiritual nature, same nature as the Supreme Lord, not this material body or material nature, not material, not matter, but spiritual reality won't be there. An interior body is just Watson course of this reading so...

segments.key_quote: Without self-realization philosophy is dry speculation or a waste of time and energy.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the importance of self-realization and the need for proper guidance from a self-realized soul to avoid speculative philosophy.
segments.transcript: you will also become an interior body full of spiritual types, not material, released which plays aší dot accumulations of the leadership powers to create a spiritual nature. The message now in the opposite of matter, so Srila Prabhupada says philosophy means to seek after the right knowledge of one's own self or the knowledge of self-realization. We are born into ignorance, so in ignorance we do not know who we are. We think I am this body, or we may think I am this mind, but we are neither the body nor the mind. We are not even at the intelligence, but we are spirit soul. So this correct understanding of our real self as spirit soul is called self-realization. So Srila Prabhupada says about self-realization, without self-realization, philosophy is dry speculation or a waste of time and energy. There are many philosophers in this world and they have the ability to think about what is the absolute truth, what is this world, who am I, or what is the ultimate reality. They can think about it, but if they don't take proper guidance from a self-realized soul, from an enlightened person, then they simply speculate and waste time and energy. So Srimad Bhagavatam gives the right knowledge of one's own self. Bhagavatam gives the right gift.

segments.key_quote: Distinctly Bhagavatam tells us there is a world we are living in which is the world of fear and there is a spiritual world which is the world where there is fearlessness.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the material world of fear with the spiritual world of fearlessness, emphasizing the goal of life as entering the kingdom of God.
segments.transcript: to Dinge Viz way of thinking about it, is that special literature which gives knowledge of one's own self, and by hearing Bhagavatam, one can get free from material attachment and enter into the kingdom of fearlessness. So distinctly Bhagavatam tells us there is a world we are living in, which is the world of fear, and there is a spiritual world, which is the world where there is fearlessness, there is no fear, akutobhayam. So we are meant to prepare ourselves by becoming free from all material attachment and thereby keeping the goal of life as entering into the kingdom of fearlessness, the kingdom of God. So Srila Prabhupada says this material world is fearfulness, spiritual world is fearlessness, material world is fearfulness.

segments.key_quote: This material world has been discovered as a prison house.

So such people anyway are always in anxiety.

segments.key_quote: Liberation or mukti means getting relief from these constant anxieties.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that liberation means freedom from anxiety, which arises from false identification with the material body.

segments.key_quote: That is possible only when the anxiety is changed to devotional service of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that relief from anxiety is possible through devotional service and enlightenment about one's real self, emphasizing the unique guidance of Shukadeva Goswami.
segments.transcript: And this material body is always subject to disease, old age, death, misery, suffering. So always in anxiety, always in anxiety. So how is it possible to get relief from all anxieties? That is possible only when the anxiety is changed to devotional service of the Supreme Lord. We should not simply try to counteract anxiety by some material methods, which we generally do. No, that's not going to be successful. We should turn to devotional service of Krishna. Only way to become completely free from all anxieties. So Srila Prabhupada says, Srimad Bhagavatam gives us the chance to change the quality of anxiety from matter to spirit, to become the true self. So this is possible only when we are not enlightened about our real self. How is this done? This is done in the association of a learned philosopher like the self realized Shukadeva Goswami, the great son of Sri Vyasadeva. Shukadeva Goswami instructed Parikshit Maharaj, what should Parikshit actually do to prepare for death and achieve perfection, going back to Godhead after quitting the body. Other saintly persons could not give this assurance to the entire world. What is the difference to Parikshit?

segments.key_quote: Shukadeva Goswami recommended to Parikshit Maharaj that you become Krishna conscious by hearing about Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Shukadeva Goswami's recommendation to Parikshit Maharaj to become Krishna conscious through hearing about Krishna, leading to transcendence and going back to Godhead.
segments.transcript: That means all other methods, other than the methods suggested by Shukadeva Goswami, are not effective in helping us to prepare for death in such a way that at the end of this life, we can go back to Godhead. So Shukadeva Goswami recommended to Parikshit Maharaj that you become Krishna conscious by hearing about Krishna, by hearing about Krishna's activities, Krishna's names, Krishna's forms, Krishna's pastimes, Krishna's devotees, Krishna's paraphernalia, Krishna's creation. Everything in connection with Krishna. Krishna Katha. You hear Krishna Katha. Absorb your mind in Krishna Katha and become completely transcendental to everything material. And in that way, if you are situated at the time of death, then you straight go back to Godhead.

segments.key_quote: He developed that attraction for Krishna by which he straight went back to Godhead after quitting the present body.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how Parikshit Maharaj took advantage of Shukadeva Goswami's association to develop attachment to Krishna and detach from material things, ultimately returning to Godhead.
segments.transcript: And that's exactly what Parikshit did. So Srila Prabhupada says, Maharaj Parikshit, after receiving warning of his death, took advantage of this opportunity by association with Shukadeva Goswami and achieved the desired result. This is Parikshit Maharaj's good fortune that he was very anxious when he was sitting for, preparing for death. He was very anxious to somehow hear about Krishna, think about Krishna, talk about Krishna, engage in devotional service to Krishna. And when he got the association of Shukadeva Goswami, he took full advantage of hearing about Krishna and getting to know about Krishna properly, and thereby becoming attached to Krishna, automatically detached from everything material. And he developed that attraction for Krishna by which he straight went back to Godhead

segments.key_quote: We should not only hear seven days but we should hear every day for rest of the life, the Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker warns against imitating the seven-day Bhagavatam recitation and emphasizes the importance of hearing Srimad Bhagavatam daily for the rest of one's life to prepare for death and return to Godhead.
segments.transcript: after quitting the present body. Srila Prabhupada warns that because Shukadeva Goswami spoke for seven days the stream of Bhagavatam to Parikshit Maharaj, other people are imitating Shukadeva Goswami by speaking Bhagavatam for only one week. They call it Bhagavata Saptaha. But this Saptaha is not at all effective. We can clearly see. So, for us to be successful in preparing ourselves to go back to Godhead, we should not only hear seven days but we should hear every day for rest of the life, the Srimad Bhagavatam. That is the recommendation of Bhagavatam: Nityam Bhagavata Sevaya. And in that way we can prepare ourselves to go back to Godhead. I will stop here. Thank you very much.
